conclusion: Analyze forces on blocks to find mass ratio of A to B.
Denote mass of block A as m_A and mass of block B as m_B.
Block A is on horizontal ground; block B is in contact with A.
Normal force on block A is N_A = m_Ag.
Frictional force between A and ground is f_A = μ_2m_Ag.
Frictional force between A and B is f_AB = μ_1N_AB.
Normal force from A on B is N_AB = m_Bg.
Frictional force between A and B is f_AB = μ_1m_Bg.
For A to slip, f_A must equal f_AB.
For B to slide, consider frictional force for equilibrium.
Solve for mass ratio: m_A/m_B = μ_1/μ_2.
Mass ratio of A to B is μ_1/μ_2.
